title: Introduction
text: tayloRswift little package add color palettes ggplot made graphics inspired Taylor Swift album covers. two functions package.

title: Introduction
code: data <- data.frame(c = LETTERS[1:3],                    x = c(1,5,7),                    y = c(5,9,13)) ggplot(data, aes(x =x, y = y, color = c)) +   geom_point(size = 4) +   scale_color_taylor(palette = "taylorRed")+   theme_minimal()

title: Introduction
code: ggplot(data, aes(x=x, fill = c))+   geom_bar()+   theme_minimal()+   scale_fill_taylor(palette = "taylorRed")

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Stephenson (2022). tayloRswift: Color Palettes Generated Taylor Swift Albums. R package version 0.2.0, https://asteves.github.io/tayloRswift/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tayloRswift: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums},   author = {Alex Stephenson},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://asteves.github.io/tayloRswift/}, }

what: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums
title: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums
text: ggplot2 color palette based Taylor Swift Album Covers.  package includes palettes every full album except Taylor Swift disavowed.

title: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums
text: can install CRAN version tayloRswift : Alternatively, can install development version : load

title: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums
text: Color discrete variable using default palette based 1989
code: ggplot(penguins, aes(bill_depth_mm, bill_length_mm, color = species)) +   geom_point(size = 4) +   scale_color_taylor()+   theme_minimal()

title: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums
code: ggplot(penguins, aes(bill_depth_mm, bill_length_mm, color = species)) +   geom_point(size = 4) +   scale_color_taylor(palette = "reputation")+   theme_minimal()

title: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums
code: ggplot(penguins , aes(bill_depth_mm, bill_length_mm,color = bill_length_mm)) +   geom_point(size = 4) +   scale_color_taylor(discrete = FALSE, palette ="fearless")+   theme_minimal()

title: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums
text: Pop color Lover  prefer modern Swift, Folklore
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(manufacturer, fill = manufacturer)) +   geom_bar() +   theme_minimal()+   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +   scale_fill_taylor(palette = "lover", guide = "none") ggplot(penguins, aes(species, fill = species)) +   geom_bar() +   theme_minimal()+   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +   scale_fill_taylor(palette = "folklore", guide = "none")

title: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums
text: taylorSwift taylorSwift= “#61b6cc”, “#577f3f”, “#e3e9f3”, “#0a1605”, “#fddac7”, “#81a757” fearless fearless = “#b68f51”, “#5b3617”, “#f7eabe”, “#ecd59f”, “#825c2d” speakNow speakNow = “#ffffff”, “#4b2671”, “#5e291c”, “#f3d8c4”, “#f3bf73” speakNowLive speakNowLive = “#fce178”, “#969696”, “#871d20”, “#090708”, “#fafaf9” Red Red = “#c2c2ae”, “#26233b”, “#7f6557”, “#b4a382”, “#eeeadf” taylorRed = “#b1532a”,“#84697f”,“#cbb593”,“#a88f92”,“#e8eadf”,“#43475b” taylor1989 taylor1989 = “#b1532a”, “#84697f”, “#cbb593”, “#a88f92”, “#e8eadf”, “#43475b” reputation reputation = “#060606”, “#6e6e6e”, “#fefefe”, “#cacaca”, “#060606”, “#8c8c8c” lover lover = “#b8396b”, “#ffd1d7”, “#fff5cc”, “#76bae0”, “#b28f81”, “#54483e” folklore folklore= “#272727”, “#5c5c5c”, “#bababa”, “#f8f8f8” evermore evermore = “#3d2620”, “#efefef”, “#827d73”, “#efefef”, “#3d2620” midnights midnights = “#586891”,“#8897A4”,“#B3A6A3”,“#2B152C”,“#F1F3F2” addition, package comes palettes alternate album covers well. midnightsBloodMoon = “#651D32”, “#80433F”, “#BC7B55”, “#AD9291”, “#E9E8E4” midnightsJadeGreen = “#E8E7E3”, “#CE986B”, “#2F3C30”, “#0B0B08”, “#B98645”, “#8D8C7A” midnightsMahogany = “#AE9975”, “#2B181F”, “#E2E1DD”, “#948266”, “#AD8E49”

title: Color Palettes Generated by Taylor Swift Albums
text: work Python, brought attention cool package Josh Borrow called swiftacsmaps. inspirations package tutorial creating corporate color palettes Dr. Simon Jackson, drew heavily. long used wesanderson package Karthik Ram, similar task.

what: Color scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_color_taylor
title: Color scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_color_taylor
Color scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_color_taylor
code: scale_color_taylor(   palette = "taylor1989",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   ... )

title: Color scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_color_taylor
text: palette Character name palette swift_palettes discrete Boolean color aesthetic discrete reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed ... Additional arguments used discrete_scale() scale_fill_gradientn() automatically interpolate colours.

title: Color scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_color_taylor
Color scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_color_taylor
code: library(ggplot2) data <- data.frame(c = LETTERS[1:3],x = c(1,5,7),y = c(5,9,13)) ggplot(data, aes(x,y,color = c))+geom_point()+scale_color_taylor()

what: Fill scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_fill_taylor
title: Fill scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_fill_taylor
Fill scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_fill_taylor
code: scale_fill_taylor(   palette = "taylor1989",   discrete = TRUE,   reverse = FALSE,   ... )

title: Fill scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_fill_taylor
text: palette Character name palette swift_palettes discrete Boolean color aesthetic discrete reverse Boolean palette reversed ... Additional arguments used discrete_scale() scale_fill_gradientn() automatically interpolate colours.

title: Fill scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_fill_taylor
Fill scale for Taylor Swift colors — scale_fill_taylor
code: library(ggplot2) data <- data.frame(c = LETTERS[1:3],x = c(1,5,7),y = c(5,9,13)) ggplot(data, aes(x,fill=c))+geom_bar()+scale_fill_taylor()
